lead_paragraph: Documents circulating through a liberal New Jersey township lately are adding new fuel to a fierce, long-running battle over education philosophy in the local schools.

headline.print_headline: Strife Lingers in Town Long After School Tests Are Mysteriously Posted Online
headline.main: Montclair Still Feels Strife From School Tests Posted Online in ’13

snippet: Documents circulating through a liberal New Jersey township lately are adding new fuel to a fierce, long-running battle over education philosophy in the local schools.
abstract: Strife continues in Montclair, NJ, years after 2013 episode in which schoool superintendent Penny MacCormack initiated complex investigation into leak of new assessment tests online; Dr MacCormack, who has since resigned, was leading controversial reform movement proposing change in teacher evaluations and initiation of charter schools; anti-reformists are demanding full inquiry into case that has highlighted nationwide concerns about testing, charter schools and performance evaluation.
